Uses of Interface
com.xhive.dom.interfaces.XhiveFunctionIf

Packages that use XhiveFunctionIf
com.xhive.dom.interfaces This package contains the library interfaces (for collections of documents) and X-Hive specific extensions to the W3C DOM Interfaces, as well as interfaces related to special DOM related data. 
 

Uses of XhiveFunctionIf in com.xhive.dom.interfaces
 

Methods in com.xhive.dom.interfaces with parameters of type XhiveFunctionIf
 void XhiveNodeIf.apply(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
          Applies the function object to this node.
 void XhiveNodeIf.traverseAllNodesDocumentOrder(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
          Traverses this node and all descending nodes, including attributes in document order, and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered node, including attributes.
 void XhiveNodeIf.traverseAncestors(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
          Traverses the ancestors and applies the function object to every ancestor, including XhiveLibraryIf objects.
 void XhiveNodeIf.traverseAttributesDocumentOrder(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
          Traverses the attributes of this node and its descendant's nodes in document order and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered attribute.
 void XhiveNodeIf.traverseBreadthFirst(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
          Traverses this node and all its descendants in 'breadth first' order and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered node.
 void XhiveNodeIf.traverseChildren(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
          Traverses the children and applies the function object to every child.
 void XhiveNodeIf.traverseDocumentOrder(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
          Traverses this node and all its descendants in document order, and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered node.
 void XhiveNodeIf.traverseReverseDocumentOrder(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
          Traverses the current node and all of its descendants in reverse document order and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered node.
